meanings.definition: The act of clearing oneself or another from an accusation by oath or ordeal.
meanings.sent1: In medieval times, compurgation was a common way to prove innocence.
meanings.sent2: The village relied on compurgation to determine who was guilty of the crime.
meanings.sent3: The courtroom was filled with tension as the accused awaited the compurgation results.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty acted as a shield during the compurgation process.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of compurgation made it accessible to all members of the community.

meanings.definition: The act of proving one's innocence or providing evidence of truth through the sworn testimony of others.
meanings.sent1: Compurgation allowed individuals to rely on the honesty of their peers.
meanings.sent2: The judge accepted the compurgation as valid evidence in the case.
meanings.sent3: The courtroom erupted in laughter when the compurgation witness accidentally sneezed.
meanings.sent4: Her friends' support served as a form of compurgation in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The power of compurgation lay in the unity of the community standing together.
